pullrequest.title: Quick fix for config errors after qtutils 2 changes

content.raw:
I was going to say that this only temporarily fixes the problem since Qt objects would still be stored, and so future updates will break again. But as you mention in the corresponding bug report, since we are now using API v2 everywhere, Qt objects will no longer be stored. We could ensure this is true everywhere by using `ast.literal_eval()` instead of `eval()`, but that is a topic for another time.

So I see this fix as appropriate backward compatibility.
content.html:
I was going to say that this only temporarily fixes the problem since Qt objects would still be stored, and so future updates will break again. But as you mention in the corresponding bug report, since we are now using API v2 everywhere, Qt objects will no longer be stored. We could ensure this is true everywhere by using ast.literal_eval() instead of eval(), but that is a topic for another time.

So I see this fix as appropriate backward compatibility.
